intro: Varronia leucomalloides, commonly known as the white-flowered varronia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers with five petals and a prominent yellow stamen. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often with a hairy texture. Varronia leucomalloides is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
